header.title: Unleash Your Telekinetic Ability: Sight Spectrum Theory. V4.2

central_thesis: Telekinesis is learnable through an analytical understanding and application of the 'Sight Spectrum Theory', which elucidates the correlations between energy and matter from a mental plane perspective, founded upon three specific fundamentals of force and managed through conscious mental states.

structure_content.summary: Defines key terminology, distinguishing the author's specific usage of words like 'author', 'you', 'he', and 'majority'. Crucially, it establishes 'brain' as referring to matter and 'mind' as referring to energy throughout the document.
Reiterates core terminological distinctions, particularly the author's unique conceptual separation of 'brain' (matter) and 'mind' (energy).

Details the author's accidental discovery of telekinesis, emphasizing an analytical approach to understanding it. Introduces the 'three fundamentals of telekinesis' and the 'Sight Spectrum Theory' as foundational concepts for unlocking telekinetic ability.

Explores the concept of force and energy (electrons) at the physical plane using analogies of magnets. It describes circular energy flow, energy obstruction, and the creation of force as a battle between conflicting energy flows, setting a groundwork for mental applications.

Introduces the 'Sight Spectrum Theory', distinguishing between 'eyesight' (not using imagination) and 'mind's eye' (using imagination) as forms of perception. It defines the 'positive' and 'negative' sight spectrums, the 'transition layer of eyesight', and the 'virtual path of the laser' as the location of one's 'will' in relation to perceived objects.

Explains various brainwave frequencies (Beta, Alpha, Theta, Delta) and their corresponding mental states and energy qualities. It discusses how these brainwaves relate to physical and mental planes, particularly in the context of 'mental plain overlapping' and the causes/effects of 'chronic depression' on mental state.

Expands on mental focus control, the 'scale of thought' (measured in Hz), and the energetic border between Alpha and Beta brainwaves. It discusses the 'physical area of no sight' where negative energy is produced, 'mind’s emotional interlinking', and introduces the 'Seven Herns' as specific energy points within the brain.
Provides a comprehensive list of terms and their precise definitions as used within the document, often cross-referencing related concepts, thus solidifying the unique vocabulary of the system.

key_concepts.definition: From Greek: Tele, at a distance; kinesis, motion. The word 'telekinesis' refers to the ability to influence (move) an object mentally.

Refers to energy, distinct from the 'brain' which refers to matter. It processes information from sight, thought, emotion and the five physical senses, and is comprised of the conscious, unconscious, and subconscious mental state.

A telekinesis concept that spans both the physical plane and mental plane by explaining the correlations of energy and matter from a mental plane perspective. The 'Sight Spectrum' consists of both the 'Negative Sight Spectrum' and the 'Positive Sight Spectrum.'
Defined as 'Sight.' All sight that one can see, regardless of what is seen with the eyes or in the imagination of the mind’s eye. It is always desirable for the practitioner.
Defined as 'No sight.' An area outside of one's sight range, physically or mentally. Nothing can be seen in this spectrum, and it is not desirable.
'Focus', 'Energy' and 'Force' are the three fundamentals of telekinesis. They must be practiced in their proper fundamental order to 'Unleash Your Telekinetic Ability'.
The first fundamental of telekinesis, defined as 'no thought loudness'. It is the mental location of the brow chakra.
The second fundamental of telekinesis, defined as literally matter in the pure form. It is the mental location of the crown chakra.
The third fundamental of telekinesis, defined as the physical location of the crown chakra. It is created when the natural circular flow of energy (electrons) is obstructed.
One's ability to move any part of the body or to act upon something, representing the very soul and the ability to influence objects or one's own body.
Literally PSI energy in the form of thought and emotion, measured in micro-voltage and hertz (Hz). Different patterns (Beta, Alpha, Theta, Delta) correspond to different mental states.

Represents sight and imagination, deep relaxation or state of light sleep, improved memory, increased focus, consciousness, and sub-consciousness. It is the state of mind where ESP abilities are most active, ranging from '7' Hz to '4' Hz.
The seven main energy points of the brain, associated with various physical sensations and discomforts, whose locations can be identified through specific pressure points on the head.

practical_system.description: The practical system for 'Unleashing Your Telekinetic Ability' is primarily internal and mental, requiring an analytical understanding and conscious application of the 'Sight Spectrum Theory' and 'The Three Fundamentals Of Telekinesis' (Focus, Energy, Force). It posits that mental energy, influenced by brainwave states, can interact with and move physical objects. The practitioner must cultivate specific mental states and awareness of the body's 'energy points' to achieve telekinetic effects.
tools: The practitioner's own 'Mind' (energy) and 'Will' (the dynamic location of that energy).
Conscious control and understanding of one's 'Brainwave Frequencies' (particularly Alpha and Theta states).
The 'internal laser beam' representing the directed mental focus and 'will' towards an object.
Anatomical knowledge and sensory awareness of the 'Seven Herns' (brain energy points/pressure points).
Introspection and self-awareness for monitoring mental states and emotional interlinking.
rituals: **Mental Focus Control:** The practitioner must develop the ability to achieve a state of 'no thought loudness,' which is defined as the 'theta' brainwave state. This involves fixing one's gaze ('laser beam') onto the target object without distraction or 'wobbling' of attention.

**Energy Regulation:** Through mental discipline, the practitioner is instructed to transition from faster brainwave states (Beta) to slower, more conducive states (Alpha and Theta), which correlate with higher 'quality of energy' and enhanced ESP abilities. This is a process of conditioning the mind without external aids.

**Will Alignment:** The core operative act involves consciously directing one's 'will' – the location of one's energy – to occupy the same spatial area as the target object within the 'positive sight spectrum'. This alignment is crucial for influencing the object mentally.

**Hern Awareness:** Practitioners are guided to locate and become aware of the 'Seven Herns,' specific 'energy points' or pressure points on the head/brain. Understanding these points and their associated sensations is integral to comprehending and managing mental energy flows, particularly tension and discomfort.

**Self-Conditioning:** A broader, ongoing practice involves learning to condition the mind to remain in a focused, calm state ('positive sight spectrum') to avoid 'negative energy' production and discomfort, which can impede telekinetic efforts.

relevant_quotes.text: All information available in the Unleash Your Telekinetic Ability document is not intended to be a substitute for any other information given by the government. Consult a qualified psychologist before you attempt to learn telekinesis.
The three fundamentals of telekinesis is literally your foundation. Once the three fundamentals are learned and then utilized, you may Unleash Your Telekinetic Ability and at that same second.
You will discover that the result of telekinesis is e=mc2 at the mental plane.
The brain and the mind are not defined as the same. All references to the brain will refer to matter, while all references to the mind will instead refer to energy.
To be able to influence an object, your eyes need to be locked on target and not wobbling around the surrounding view. Focus is the first fundamental and used to influence energy.
The seven Herns are main energy points of the brain.

critical_analysis.relevance: This document presents a highly idiosyncratic and non-standard theoretical framework for telekinesis, moving beyond typical parapsychological or occult explanations. It attempts to provide a mechanistic, 'esoteric physics' model for mind-matter interaction, rooted in unique definitions of mind (energy), brain (matter), and the 'Sight Spectrum Theory'. While offering an internally consistent logic, its reliance on unverified concepts like 'e=mc2 at the mental plane' and the 'Seven Herns' positions it as a work of personal gnosis or a modern esoteric system rather than one aligned with established scientific or traditional magical paradigms. Its detailed, analytical approach to 'how' telekinesis functions makes it a distinct contribution to the speculative theories of psychokinesis.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The author explicitly targets the 'analytical thinker' who seeks a deep, literal understanding and 'proof' for telekinesis, desiring to comprehend the interplay between the mental and physical planes. It is not intended for those seeking a quick, practical guide, but rather for individuals willing to engage with a complex theoretical framework and its unique terminology. The repeated disclaimers to consult psychologists suggest an awareness that the concepts presented may be challenging or unconventional for a general audience.
